summary: This is probably the oldest piece of Shazam memorabilia that I own. From 1945, this is one long piece of heavy weight paper...
body: This is probably the oldest piece of Shazam memorabilia that I own. From 1945, this is one long piece of heavy weight paper folded into what you see here. Just 5 years after Captain Marvel appeared, the rest of the Marvel Family had been introduced and there was all kinds of merch for them.

reblog.comment: This is probably the oldest piece of Shazam memorabilia that I own. From 1945, this is one long piece of heavy weight paper folded into what you see here. Just 5 years after Captain Marvel appeared, the rest of the Marvel Family had been introduced and there was all kinds of merch for them.

Just 5 years after Captain Marvel appeared, the rest of the Marvel Family had been introduced and there was all kinds of merch for them.
trail.content: This is probably the oldest piece of Shazam memorabilia that I own. From 1945, this is one long piece of heavy weight paper folded into what you see here. Just 5 years after Captain Marvel appeared, the rest of the Marvel Family had been introduced and there was all kinds of merch for them.

summary:
The Avengers Reunited!
If Avengers: Endgame really is going to be the last time we will see our favourites together, I just want...
body:
The Avengers Reunited!

If Avengers: Endgame really is going to be the last time we will see our favourites together, I just want to be able to see the reunions…

  • Like, Tony and Steve putting the events of Civil War behind them, even if just for a short while, to look out for one another. If that scene from the trailer is in the movie (you know the one), how great would that be? That trust would grow again, and the team would come together once more. We’d see them fighting alongside one another, Tony probably throwing in the usual banter like “language!” as they bust through the villains together like old times. Steve would just roll his eyes and laugh, since he knew there would be no point arguing because that sarcasm will never change- it is Tony Stark, after all! Besides, he’d just be grateful that Tony was still alive, and he would definitely show this by the way he looks at him, trying not to let him out of his sight again.
  • For Bruce and Tony to meet again (but for longer than they did in Infinity War without having to be disrupted by aliens) would mark the return of Science Bros! Peter would definitely join in with this, and perhaps even Shuri if the chance ever came about. It would literally just be them getting so excited about sciencey-stuff, with each one adding more and more for ages until they are fully geeked out.
  • And I’m just craving the moment that the fallen return, and run to their loved ones. Peter seeing Tony for the first time and running to him, each hugging one another so tightly they can’t breath. Tony promising he’ll never let Peter down again (even though he didn’t in the first place, and Peter would reassure him this because in his eyes, Tony Stark could never do any wrong to him). Literally the Irondad content I’ve been longing for the most since they lost…
  • What if Loki was to be resserected too? Oh my; Thor would be so happy- the guilt of his brother’s death would be relieved as they embrace, Thor promising to never let him go again and saying, “you really weren’t the worst brother Loki, I’m so sorry”. The old Loki would usually just shrug him off, but he has changed now- he returns the hug, as he too apologises to his big brother for leaving him. The bitterness of their past would simply melt away, replaced by nothing but love and hope that they could win this once and for all…
  • I don’t even care how much this would be the sort of ending that is predictable and cliche, one that would seem like ‘lazy writing’ because it isn’t the sort of thing Marvel does, but I just want them to all reunite so we can see new interactions.
  • What about Peter and Shuri meeting for the first time, with Tony and T'Challa looking on in complete confusion and amusement as they make meme reference after meme reference, laughing till they can’t breath anymore? It’d be great! Tony would look at T'Challa in complete bewilderement and he would just shrug his shoulders and laugh, “don’t even ask”.
  • And Pepperony’s wedding. Oh wow, there’d be so many guests! Like, Rhodey being Tony’s best man and coming up with the most embarrasing stories for the speech from their school days; Peter being seated towards the front because Tony insisted he should be close to them when they get married, for him to embark on the next chapter of their lives with them; the evening do when everyone is dancing and just having fun, together, like that big purple asshole never turned up in the first place and ruined everything.
  • We’d probably even get to see Tony have his first child, with Peter acting like a big brother, being super protective because he loves them so much! With that in mind, Harley could have even made an appearance, and what an emotional scene that would be.

So, yeah- there is so much that I’d want to see from these guys. Just to see them together again, bantering and as happy as they could be after the Snap. But more than anything, I just want to see Peter and Tony’s bond to grow ever stronger, for that father-son relationship to increase all the more because that is what they deserve after all they went through.

It’s going to be so hard for me to let go of my childhood heroes- it still seems way too soon to say goodbye to them.

What a way to mark the end of an era…

blog.description:
I'm not saying i have the best comic blog on tumblr but i am definitely in the top one.

He/Him/His

MESSAGE WARNING!
I get a LOT of messages. You are a LOT more likely to get a reply if you aren't anonymous. If i get to a point that i think i am posting too many messages i will stop. People do not follow this blog to read messages. It may end up never getting posted. Sorry.
Also.. Tumblr swallows some of my replies. So i may have actually replied to you. Nothing i can do unfortunately.

summary: Higher Further Prettier baby ! Makeup Captain Marvel 🌟
title: Higher Further Prettier baby ! Makeup Captain Marvel 🌟
body:
Il y a exactement un mois et deux jours, je m’apprêtais à aller à l’avant-première de Captain Marvel, et je décidai de me faire un maquillage dans le thème. Aujourd’hui je vous partage les étapes de ce maquillage, si jamais vous avez envie de le reproduire !

J’ai peur qu’il ne soit un peu compliqué pour des débutant·e·s, je vais donc essayer d’inclure des alternatives aux techniques que j’utilise, mais aussi aux produits.

Voici ce que j’ai utilisé : une ombre à paupière rouge, bleue et dorée, un liner doré, un crayon marron gras, de l’anti-cernes et un pinceau fin.

Je commence par tracer la forme de l’étoile au crayon, que je peux effacer facilement en frottant puisqu’il est gras. Peu importe sa couleur, on recouvrira les traits plus tard.

J’applique ensuite du rouge sur ma paupière entière, en évitant la zone de l’étoile. Comme il est très difficile de trouver un vrai rouge en ombre à paupière, qui ne tire pas vers le rose ou l’orange, je mélange les deux rouges de ma palette Magic de Juvia’s Place : Zakiya, qui a des sous-tons orangés, et Kogi, qui a des sous-tons roses.

J’applique ensuite le bleu de ma palette Ultimate de Nyx sur mon ras de cil inférieur en le reliant à la pointe en rouge. J’estompe bien les bords des deux, mais je ne les mélange pas ensemble puisque je vais faire un trait de liner entre les deux.

Je nettoie la forme de l’étoile avec de l’anti-cernes et un pinceau fin.

Je remplis ensuite l’étoile avec l’ombre à paupière dorée de ma palette Prism d’Anastasia Beverly Hills, et mon coin interne avec celui de ma palette Juvia’s place, plus clair.

Finalement, je précise les contours de l’étoile avec mon liner doré. Si vous n’en avez pas, vous pouvez utiliser une ombre à paupière jaune pour l’étoile et faire le contour avec un pinceau fin et une ombre à paupière dorée foncé. 

Je vous conseille également l’astuce de la maquilleuse MarionCameleon pour avoir des liners de toutes les couleurs : avec un produit appelé Inglot de Duraline, vous pouvez transformer des produits poudrés en gel ! Et ce n’est pas permanent, donc pas de risque de ruiner sa palette.

Je trace finalement un trait de liner entre les deux couleurs, et c’est fini ! ˆˆ 

Ombrage
body_abstract: Il y a exactement un mois et deux jours, je m’apprêtais à aller à l’avant-première de Captain Marvel, et je décidai de me faire un maquillage dans le thème. Aujourd’hui je vous partage les étapes de ce maquillage, si jamais vous avez envie de le reproduire !

reblog.comment:
Il y a exactement un mois et deux jours, je m’apprêtais à aller à l’avant-première de Captain Marvel, et je décidai de me faire un maquillage dans le thème. Aujourd’hui je vous partage les étapes de ce maquillage, si jamais vous avez envie de le reproduire !

[[MORE]]

J’ai peur qu’il ne soit un peu compliqué pour des débutant·e·s, je vais donc essayer d’inclure des alternatives aux techniques que j’utilise, mais aussi aux produits.

Voici ce que j’ai utilisé : une ombre à paupière rouge, bleue et dorée, un liner doré, un crayon marron gras, de l’anti-cernes et un pinceau fin.

Je commence par tracer la forme de l’étoile au crayon, que je peux effacer facilement en frottant puisqu’il est gras. Peu importe sa couleur, on recouvrira les traits plus tard.

J’applique ensuite du rouge sur ma paupière entière, en évitant la zone de l’étoile. Comme il est très difficile de trouver un vrai rouge en ombre à paupière, qui ne tire pas vers le rose ou l’orange, je mélange les deux rouges de ma palette Magic de Juvia’s Place : Zakiya, qui a des sous-tons orangés, et Kogi, qui a des sous-tons roses.

J’applique ensuite le bleu de ma palette Ultimate de Nyx sur mon ras de cil inférieur en le reliant à la pointe en rouge. J’estompe bien les bords des deux, mais je ne les mélange pas ensemble puisque je vais faire un trait de liner entre les deux.

Je nettoie la forme de l’étoile avec de l’anti-cernes et un pinceau fin.

Je remplis ensuite l’étoile avec l’ombre à paupière dorée de ma palette Prism d’Anastasia Beverly Hills, et mon coin interne avec celui de ma palette Juvia’s place, plus clair.

Finalement, je précise les contours de l’étoile avec mon liner doré. Si vous n’en avez pas, vous pouvez utiliser une ombre à paupière jaune pour l’étoile et faire le contour avec un pinceau fin et une ombre à paupière dorée foncé. 

Je vous conseille également l’astuce de la maquilleuse MarionCameleon pour avoir des liners de toutes les couleurs : avec un produit appelé Inglot de Duraline, vous pouvez transformer des produits poudrés en gel ! Et ce n’est pas permanent, donc pas de risque de ruiner sa palette.

Je trace finalement un trait de liner entre les deux couleurs, et c’est fini ! ˆˆ 

Ombrage

trail.content_raw:

Je remplis ensuite l’étoile avec l’ombre à paupière dorée de ma palette Prism d’Anastasia Beverly Hills, et mon coin interne avec celui de ma palette Juvia’s place, plus clair.

Finalement, je précise les contours de l’étoile avec mon liner doré. Si vous n’en avez pas, vous pouvez utiliser une ombre à paupière jaune pour l’étoile et faire le contour avec un pinceau fin et une ombre à paupière dorée foncé.

summary: Took a deep dive into Captain Marvel fanfiction. The most popular ship is by far Carol/Maria, followed by...
body:
Took a deep dive into Captain Marvel fanfiction. The most popular ship is by far Carol/Maria, followed by Carol/Yon-Rogg.

Carol/Maria is all domestic fluff and sexyfuntime (Self explanatory. They raised a child together), and Carol/Yon-Rogg is 97% femdom (To he expected after the people behind the movie explained that he is equally terrified and in love with her because he always knew she was stronger than him, and eventually just gave up and let her manhandle him)

summary: Why Captain Marvel Has on More Make-Up in Endgame Than Her Solo Movie
title: Why Captain Marvel Has on More Make-Up in Endgame Than Her Solo Movie
excerpt: What’s up with the make-up? That’s what fans wanted to know after the second trailer for Avengers: Endgame, which finally added Captain Marvel into the manic mix of superheroes. Many noticed that in her solo outing, which was directed by a man and a woman, Carol Danvers didn’t wear much make-up, but in Endgame, which is directed by two men, she was glammed up. Questions arose regarding the perspectives of the different directors.
